trans-unit.source: Introducing the Windows PowerShell ISE
trans-unit.target: Introducing the Windows PowerShell ISE

trans-unit.source: powershell,cmdlet
trans-unit.target: powershell,cmdlet

trans-unit.source: Introducing the Windows PowerShell ISE
trans-unit.target: Introducing the Windows PowerShell ISE

trans-unit.source: The Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) is a host application for Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: The Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) is a host application for Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: In Windows PowerShell ISE, you can run commands and write, test, and debug scripts in a single Windows-based graphic user interface with multiline editing, tab completion, syntax coloring, selective execution, context-sensitive help, and support for right-to-left languages.
trans-unit.target: In Windows PowerShell ISE, you can run commands and write, test, and debug scripts in a single Windows-based graphic user interface with multiline editing, tab completion, syntax coloring, selective execution, context-sensitive help, and support for right-to-left languages.

trans-unit.source: You can use menu items and keyboard shortcuts to perform many of the same tasks that you would perform in the Windows PowerShell console.
trans-unit.target: You can use menu items and keyboard shortcuts to perform many of the same tasks that you would perform in the Windows PowerShell console.

trans-unit.source: For example, when you debug a script in the Windows PowerShell ISE, to set a line breakpoint in a script, right-click the line of code, and then click **Toggle Breakpoint**.
trans-unit.target: For example, when you debug a script in the Windows PowerShell ISE, to set a line breakpoint in a script, right-click the line of code, and then click **Toggle Breakpoint**.

trans-unit.source: Try these features in Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: Try these features in Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: Multiline editing: To insert a blank line under the current line in the Command pane, press SHIFT+ENTER.
trans-unit.target: Multiline editing: To insert a blank line under the current line in the Command pane, press SHIFT+ENTER.

trans-unit.source: Selective execution: To run part of a script, select the text you want to run, and then click the **Run Script** button.
trans-unit.target: Selective execution: To run part of a script, select the text you want to run, and then click the **Run Script** button.

trans-unit.source: Or, press F5.
trans-unit.target: Or, press F5.

trans-unit.source: Context-sensitive help: Type **Invoke-Item**, and then press F1.
trans-unit.target: Context-sensitive help: Type **Invoke-Item**, and then press F1.

trans-unit.source: The Help file opens to the Help topic for the **Invoke-Item** cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: The Help file opens to the Help topic for the **Invoke-Item** cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: The Windows PowerShell ISE lets you customize some aspects of its appearance.
trans-unit.target: The Windows PowerShell ISE lets you customize some aspects of its appearance.

trans-unit.source: It also has its own Windows PowerShell profile, where you can store functions, aliases, variables, and commands you use in the Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: It also has its own Windows PowerShell profile, where you can store functions, aliases, variables, and commands you use in the Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: To start the Windows PowerShell ISE
trans-unit.target: To start the Windows PowerShell ISE

trans-unit.source: Do one of the following:
trans-unit.target: Do one of the following:

trans-unit.source: Click **Start**, point to **All Programs**, point to **Windows PowerShell V2**, and then click **Windows PowerShell ISE**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Start**, point to **All Programs**, point to **Windows PowerShell V2**, and then click **Windows PowerShell ISE**.

trans-unit.source: In the Windows PowerShell console Cmd.exe, or in the Run box, type, **powershell_ise.exe**.
trans-unit.target: In the Windows PowerShell console Cmd.exe, or in the Run box, type, **powershell_ise.exe**.

trans-unit.source: To get Help in the Windows PowerShell ISE
trans-unit.target: To get Help in the Windows PowerShell ISE

trans-unit.source: On the **Help** menu, click **Windows PowerShell Help**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Help** menu, click **Windows PowerShell Help**.

trans-unit.source: Or, press F1.
trans-unit.target: Or, press F1.

trans-unit.source: The file that opens describes Windows PowerShell ISE and Windows PowerShell, including all of the help available from the Get-Help cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: The file that opens describes Windows PowerShell ISE and Windows PowerShell, including all of the help available from the Get-Help cmdlet.
